int libpg::Observation::getSteps (  ) 

Get count of the number of steps in optimisation/evaluation so far. This may only be reset in between epochs (in the case of batch learning) Or after a complete learning reset (i.e., reset of parameters). Any part of the controller/agent code may use this. E.g., if the policy is non-stationary, or if step sizes need to be computed based on optimisation steps. It may only be set by the RLAlg class.

void libpg::Observation::setAgent ( int  a  ) 

set which agent this observation is destined for. Used by approximators and controllers that single out a particular part of the feature matrix depending on the agent.

int libpg::Observation::getAgent (  ) 

Find out which agent is being represented now. Assists with pulling out the correct part of the features, but exactly how this is done depends on the controller and approximators involved.

Matrix libpg::Observation::features [protected]

The actual full observation, filled in by the simulator

Definition at line 16 of file Observation.hh.

Referenced by getFeatures(), init(), and operator=().

bVector libpg::Observation::eligible [protected]

A vector that describes which action are available It's up to a controller to decide how to use this, if at all. It is initialised to dimension=number of agents if agents>1 and the number of actions otherwise.

Note: This is not a boost::numeric::ublas vector, but an STL one !

Definition at line 26 of file Observation.hh.

Referenced by getEligible(), init(), and operator=().

int libpg::Observation::agent [protected]

Another optional variable designed for multiple controllers where the observation for each agent is encoded as a row or column of the observation vector. Determines which row or col should be used in the current controller. Basically an efficiency thing, avoiding copying a potentially large observation column into a stand alone column

Definition at line 37 of file Observation.hh.

Referenced by getAgent(), init(), operator=(), and setAgent().

int libpg::Observation::steps [protected]

A count of the number of steps in optimisation/evaluation so far. This may only be reset in between epochs (in the case of batch learning) Or after a complete learning reset (i.e., reset of parameters). Any part of the controller/agent code may use this. E.g., if the policy is non-stationary, or if step sizes need to be computed based on optimisation steps. It may only be set by the RLAlg class.
